abstract: Wells Fargo said its earnings rose in part because it was more cautious with mortgage lending and less willing to engage in volatile Wall Street trading.
snippet: Wells Fargo said its earnings rose in part because it was more cautious with mortgage lending and less willing to engage in volatile Wall Street trading.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Within weeks of scooping up the failed banking operations of Washington Mutual in late 2008, JPMorgan Chase began phasing out the WaMu brand, replacing signs on retail branches. WaMu accounts became Chase accounts. Just over a year later, the conversion was done, turning the WaMu name into a relic of the financial crisis.

headline.main: Careful Approach Works for Wells Fargo, as Earnings Rise 7%
headline.print_headline: Careful Approach Works for Wells Fargo, as Earnings Rise 7%

abstract: Morgan Stanley’s latest report missed analysts’ estimates and included an unexpected $91 million loss. After a decent first half of the year, it’s a setback.
snippet: Morgan Stanley’s latest report missed analysts’ estimates and included an unexpected $91 million loss. After a decent first half of the year, it’s a setback.
lead_paragraph: James Gorman, Morgan Stanley’s chief executive, took one on the nose in the third quarter. While his peers have largely beat analysts’ estimates, Mr. Gorman presided over results that not only missed the target but included an unexpected $91 million loss. In fact, the company had to rely on one-time items to avoid an even worse showing. After a decent first half of the year, it’s a setback.

headline.main: For Morgan Stanley, a Bad Report but the Right Track

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and IAN CAMPBELL
